subject: Re: A question for the ghost hunters of the group
author: kolrone
full_text:
On just a basic investigation with only a couple of people, we
normally use:
Digital cameras
Video Cameras: Sony DCR-HC52 with Sony Infrared Extender HVL-IRM
Digital Voice Recorders: My favorite is the Olympus WS-300M
EMF Meters; one with a digital display, the other with a multicolor
LED readout
Hacked 12-469
And Wavepad and Audacity for editing the audio (Mainly audacity)

-Aaron

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Cheri Esperon" <cesperon@...> wrote:
>
> Sure.. I'll offer up our gear list.
> 
> Digital Cameras
> Video cameras with night vision (we have several different kinds and
brands)
> KII meter
> Emf Meter
> IR security cameras with a DVR wired.. not wireless.
> Digital Video Recorders
> Thermal Imaging camera- when we can get use of it (we have a coast
guard member and a fire fighter on our team both of which can get the
cameras from time to time)
> Motion detectors
> Scout Cameras
> Laser trap (a home made laser grid that has motion detectors on it..
we keep a video camera on it and if the grid gets broken.. well.. then
we might have caught something)
> Flashlights
> Two way radios
> UV flashlights
> Oh.. of course pen & paper..
> 
> and we are working on a couple alternate light source cameras 
> We have also experimented with negative ions using an ionizer.. that
is still in the works
>
